text: تنزع الناس كانهم اعجاز نخل منقعر

translations.translation: It plucked up men like uprooted stumps.
Which snatched away men as though they were palm trees pulled out by the roots.
which tore people away and hurled them as though they were trunks of uprooted palm-trees.
which hurled people around like uprooted trunks of palm-trees.
Smashing down men as if they were uprooted trunks of date palms.
Plucking out men as if they were uprooted stems of date palms.
Tearing men away as if they were the trunks of palm-trees torn up.
plucking up men as if they were stumps of uprooted palm-trees.
Sweeping men away as though they were uprooted trunks of palm-trees.
It swept people away as if they were trunks of uprooted palm trees.
Carrying men away as though they were trunks of palm-trees uprooted.
knocking down people as if they were trunks of uprooted palm trees.
Plucking out men as if they were roots of palm-trees torn up (from the ground).
Plucking out men as if they were uprooted stems of date-palms.
and snatched people up as though they were stumps of uprooted palmtrees.
Plucking the people away, as though they were trunks of uprooted palm-trees.
Extracting the people as if they were trunks of palm trees uprooted.

[54:20] tearing people away, wrenching them from the holes in the ground in which they had been embedded and flinging them down [to the ground] head first, thereby crushing their necks and severing [their] heads from [their] bodies, as if they were, [while lying] in this mentioned state, trunks of uprooted palm-trees, severed and thrown on the ground — they are likened to palm-trees because of their tallness (nakhlun, ‘palm-trees’, is masculine here but feminine in [sūrat] al-Hāqqa, nakhlun khāwiya, ‘fallen down [or hollow] palm-trees’, [Q. 69:7], in order to harmonise with the end-rhyme of the verses in both instances).
(Sweeping men away as though they were uprooted trunks of palm-trees.

commentaries.author: زيد بن علي
commentaries.text: وقوله تعالى: { كَأَنَّهُمْ أَعْجَازُ نَخْلٍ مُّنقَعِرٍ } معناه المُنقطعُ

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text: ومن شدة جريها وحركتها { تَنزِعُ } وتقلع { ٱلنَّاسَ } عن أماكنهم، مع أنهم دخلوا في الحفر، وتشبثوا بالأثقال { كَأَنَّهُمْ أَعْجَازُ نَخْلٍ } أي: أصول نخل { مُّنقَعِرٍ } [القمر: 20] منقلب عن مغارسه، ساقط على الأرض، موتى بلا روح

commentaries.author: ابن عجيبة
commentaries.text:
ثم صاروا بعد موتهم { كأنهم أعجازُ نخل مُنقَعرٍ } أي: أصول نخل منقلع من مغارسه، وشُبِّهوا بأعجاز النخلة، وهي أصولها التي قطعت روؤسها لأنّ الريح كانت تقطع رؤوسهم، فتبقى أجساداً بلا رؤوس، فيتساقطون على الأرض أمواتاً، وهم جثث طوال
 وتذكير صفة النخل بالنظر إلى اللفظ، كما أن تأنيثه في قوله تعالى:
